questions.question: The war had a dramatic ........................... on oil prices.
questions.description: Effect is a noun. Affect is a verb.

questions.question: Did the war ........................... oil prices?
questions.description: Affect is the verb effect is a noun.

questions.question: Travel can be an excellent ............................ to one's education.
The hostess received glowing ......................... on the dinner.
questions.description: A compliment is an expression of praise.

questions.question: I made ......................... inquiries about his credit rating.
questions.description: Discreet means cautious, judicious discrete means separate or distinct.

questions.question: Churchill was one of the world's most ........................ statesmen.
Writing ad copy was a .......................... of her creative talent.
Parts of the document are faded and ......................
Mirrors give an ............................ of more space in a room.
The teacher made an ......................... to Shakespeare.
questions.description: An allusion is a reference. An illusion is a false impression.

questions.question: The student did ............................ research research before writing the term paper.
questions.description: Exhaustive means comprehensive. If something is exhausting, it is tiring.
